author: JUANMA VELASCO
title: Iñaki Williams: "Era importante abrir el marcador y en el primer gol la he pegado con la ayuda de todos" | Marca
text:
U na lona negra con la leyenda Unique in the world. Sevilla 2024 presidió la celebración que los jugadores del Athletic hicieron en el campo con camisetas y bufandas conmemorativas por el regreso a una final de Copa con público . El festejo fue completo sobre el césped y tuvo a Iñaki Williams, autor del 1-0 y asistente del 2-0, como uno de los principales protagonistas, aunque también tuvo tiempo de atender a las cámaras en directo de Teledeporte.
El delantero internacional estaba feliz y satisfecho. "Era importante abrir el marcador y la he pegado con toda la ayuda de San Mamés. En los dos primeros goles nos ha salido redondo a mí hemano y mí. El año pasado nos quedó un gusto amargo por no poder celebrar el pase y ahora vamos a celebrarlo ", señaló.
Los jugadores dieron una vuelta de honor al campo y saludaron frente a los dos fondos del estadio. Todos los técnicos y auxiliares del equipo se unieron a la celebración de los jugadores....que Valverde no quiere que sea extensa por eso de que el domingo recibirá al Barça en Liga en San Mamés.

title: Ground News - L’Oreal heiress Francoise Bettencourt Meyers is the first woman with a $100 billion fortune, according to Bloomberg
text:
Summary by KRDO By Ramishah Maruf, CNN New York (CNN) — Francoise Bettencourt Meyers, the L’Oreal heiress and richest woman in the world, has become the first woman to hold a $100 billion fortune, Bloomberg reported Thursday. This is evident from the Billionaires Index by the financial news agency “Bloomberg”. author: Luke Funk
title: Video: 4-Year-Old Rescued After Being Lost in California Wilderness for Nearly 24 Hours | HNGN - Headlines & Global News
text: (Photo : Fresno County Sheriff's office) Christian Ramirez was missing for 22 hours A 4-year-old boy is safe and reunited with his family after spending nearly 24 hours [ missing in the California wilderness](https://www.hngn.com/articles/261638/20240623/california-hiker-survived-lost-mountains-wilderness-berries-week.htm). Christian Ramirez's family reported the young boy [missing](https://www.hngn.com/articles/261205/20240604/girl-missing-bus-stop-pennsylvania-vanished-1985-cherrie-mahan.htm) on Thursday after searching for him at the Rancheria Campground, on the northeastern side of Huntington Lake. The [Fresno County Sheriff's Office says](https://www.facebook.com/FresnoSheriff/videos/487440496963331) more than 50 people took part in the "non-stop" hunt for little Christian. At around 8 a.m. Friday, members of the Tulare County Search and Rescue Team found Ramirez about a quarter-mile away from where he was last seen. He was found "nestled under a tree" near the lake. "He was hungry and exhausted, but otherwise in good health. We got him a sandwich and then carried him out to be reunited with Mom and Dad," the Fresno County Sheriff's Office said. A video showed the boy eating and talking to a rescuer who carried him down the mountain. The searchers posed for a photo with the happy parents after a reunion with their son. "This was an amazing show of teamwork and dedication," the sheriff's office said. With TMX

organizations.name: tulare county search and rescue team
